intro: Racosperma obliquinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown and attract nectar-feeding insects. Racosperma obliquinervium is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
